utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, it’s not a great time, what do you want?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (in the apartment)
utterance.content: Hello to you, too. I’m sorry, but this is important.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Back to the Future II was in the Back to the Future III case, and Back to the Future III was, get this, in the Back to the Future II case.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, did you do that, or am I in the house with an intruder?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, I got to go inside. It’s getting rough out here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re dodging the question, I knew it was you. What was that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What was what?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This isn’t a very good connection, but it sounded like someone just released a kraken.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, I’m hanging up now. You know there’s no such thing as a k…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny. Penny. Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s the matter?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Um, well, I was worried that you might be missing Leonard. And that might be causing you to have bad dreams, like the kind you’d get if you watched Clash of the Titans right before you went to bed.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sweetie, did you have a bad dream?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: To be honest, I did.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Aw.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Back to the Future II was in the Back to the Future III case. Leonard did it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Good night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, wait. Perhaps I should sleep here so you don’t miss Leonard as much, uh, ’cause you’re being kind of a baby about it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know what? That would make me feel better. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re welcome. Good night.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I think you’d be pleased to hear that this morning in the parking garage I saw this oil stain on the ground that was shaped just like my ex-girlfriend, Lucy, and I didn’t get upset at all.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m proud of you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, you should be, ’cause she was looking good.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Dear Lord, you’re an astronomer. Although you may have earthly woes, get your mind back on the stars. Gee, even the lowly dung beetle chooses to plot its course by using the Milky Way.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Is that true?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Everything I say is true. Now, of course, the dung beetle also enjoys eating faeces, living in faeces and making little balls out of faeces, so, you know, pick and choose which aspects of its lifestyle you want to embrace.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Come on, you can talk to girls now. It shouldn’t be hard for you to meet someone new.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How can I meet someone new when everywhere I look, I see Lucy’s face? Tell me you don’t see her smile in the crust of this chicken pot pie.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, will you stop it. Now, listen to me, there’s a welcome party for incoming post-docs tonight. Go to it and meet someone who isn’t made of grease or pie.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You think you’re so cool because your wife is a person?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look, Bernie’s at a neuroscience conference with Amy, I’ll go with you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You would do that for me?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Of course. You’re my friend. I want you to be happy.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thanks. Oh, Sheldon, since Amy’s out of town, would you like to join us?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I want you to be happy, too, but not enough to do anything about it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette (on phone)
utterance.content: Howie, stop. I can’t talk like that. Amy’s right here.

utterance.speaker: Amy (on phone)
utterance.content: Sheldon, stop. For the last time, I will not bring home bed bugs.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: The hotel’s nice. There’s a pool, a gym, the bar looks like fun.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Because I looked in the bed, and there are no bugs.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Aw, I love you, too. If I don’t talk to you before you go to sleep, I’ll meet you in dreamland.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Good night. No, I will not consider sleeping in my garment bag.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny, did you ever wonder how Starfleet captains…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, now that I’ve piqued your interest, welcome to the exciting world of 3D chess.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why don’t you just admit you only want to play this game because you always play it with Leonard and you miss him?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You overestimate his significance in my life.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do I miss how he makes a face on my toaster waffle with syrup? No. Do I miss the way he fixes the zipper on my jacket when it gets stuck? I don’t think so. Do I miss how we say good night to each other through the walls of our bedroom using Morse code?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I get it, I get it. You are an emotionless robot.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I try.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, let’s just get this stupid game over with.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Great. I’ll go first.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: By the way, how are you with zippers?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I really need to go to the bathroom, and this one’s gone all cattywampus.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wow, your work on jellyfish neural nets sounds so interesting.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: It is. You can download my paper off the university server.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I will. You can download my paper on the Van Allen Belts from the university server as well.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: I will.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How’d it go?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, if you like dry, factual statements interspersed with painful moments of silence, it was bananas.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Check it out. Mrs. Davis from Human Resources is here. She’s probably on the lookout for sexual harassment.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, great. There go my chances of being sexually harassed.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I heard her husband left her for a hot, young undergrad.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s so much better than the old, ugly ones.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Davis
utterance.content: Mr. Wolowitz, Dr. Koothrappali.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Mrs. Davis, nice to see you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know, I recently read a fascinating article on infidelity among penguins.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Davis
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So if the fact that your husband left you makes you feel unattractive, just remember, penguins get cheated on, and they’re adorable.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It was better when you couldn’t talk to women.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I was thinking of going to the lecture on posterior cingulate cortex lesions in the formation of autobiographical memory.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, brain lesions are fascinating. Unless they’re yours, then they’re a drag.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: To the advancement of science.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And to the sick and dying who make it possible.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: This is fun, we never really get to talk shop with Penny around. We usually just end up talking about boys.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Which is fine, but it’s nice to mix it up with a little intellectual conversation.

utterance.speaker: Waiter
utterance.content: From the two gentlemen at the bar.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, my gosh, boys bought us drinks, boys bought us drinks. Thank you, thank you, thank you so much.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Be cool.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You be cool. Guys are hitting on us, and not just to get to Penny.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You’re right. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ooh. Bad move.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? Why?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My queen can now take your rook from below.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So that means I lose, right? It’s over?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If I make this move, but I won’t because we’re having too much fun.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, let’s take a break.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We’re all out of alcohol.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I wasn’t going to get alcohol. Gosh, I wonder what Leonard’s doing right now. I miss him so much.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, if you’d like, we could call him. I mean that you could call him. As I’ve explained, the absence of my friends does not cause me pain. As rock and roll bad boy Paul Simon once said, I am a rock, I am an i-i-i-island.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m calling him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, goodie, put him on speaker phone.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (on board boat, at a party, dancing)
utterance.content: Excuse me, ladies, my pants are buzzing. North Sea, how can I kelp you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny? Hey, it’s Penny. Everybody say hi to Penny.

utterance.speaker: Everybody
utterance.content: Hi, Penny!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow, it sounds like you’re having a good time.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Best time of my life.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Isn’t it five thirty in the morning there?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Is it? Hey, everybody, it’s five thirty in the morning!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, okay, well, we were just calling you because we were missing you.

utterance.speaker: Random voice
utterance.content: Iceberg!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh-oh, hang on.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you in danger?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, it’s a drinking game. Whenever we see an iceberg, we take a shot!

utterance.speaker: Everybody
utterance.content: Berg! Berg! Berg! Berg! Berg! Berg!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard, Leonard? I cannot believe we were missing that jerk.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You were.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So what happened? How’d it go?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s fine. I thanked them again and let them know we’re not available.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So I can drink this without having to give up the goodies?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yes, it’s all cool. Although, if you wanted to talk to one of them, no one would blame you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And why would no one blame me?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t know what I’m saying.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, it sounds like you’re saying that I could do better than Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Boy, these drinks are strong. Hoo, mama, I’m gonna be huggin’ the toilet tonight.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, tell me, I want to know what you meant by that.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I just meant that you’re not married and your boyfriend’s kind of, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And your husband is extremely Howard. What’s your point?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Sorry. I have no point. That was a stupid thing to say. Can we please just go back to having a nice time?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: We could, but unfortunately my brain is lesion-free and I remember that rotten thing you just said about my sweet baboo.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Come on. I apologize. Can we please just let it go?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Your husband’s weird and his clothes are ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I can’t believe it. All this time I’ve been doing nothing but sit around and miss that guy. And you know what the worst part is?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That you’re having to process your emotional pain without vodka?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. Yeah. But you know what the second-worst part is? He does not miss me at all.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Allow me to comfort you. At least you’ve got your health.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? That, that’s it? That’s comforting?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Um, uh, in a hundred years, you’ll both be dead and it won’t matter?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. Come on, you’re supposed to say, of course he misses you, the only reason he’s partying is to cover up his pain.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no, I don’t think that’s true at all.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: This is ridiculous. Why am I upset just because he’s off having a good time?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, perhaps you’re obsessively picturing him engaged in drunken coitus with another woman. Is that it? Did I get it right?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, that, that’s great. You can stop trying to make me feel better now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Actually, I can’t. Before Leonard left, he made me promise that I’d take care of you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: He did?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, that’s really sweet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Plus, if I do a good job, he said he’d bring me back a sailor’s cap.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, now I miss him even more.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, if it’s any consolation, I’m sure Leonard’s tormented every moment he’s away from your warm embrace and cherry lips.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, seriously?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, excuse me, Mrs. Davis?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Davis
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’d like to apologize for being insensitive. And for possibly making penguins seem like jerks, because 99% of them are stand-up guys.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Davis
utterance.content: Forget about it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know, you, you and I, you and I have a lot in common.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Davis
utterance.content: Is that right?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, yes, I, I too am in the throes of heartbreak. Okay, fine, I’ll tell you about it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Here is a hot beverage to comfort you. It’s in a to-go cup. Make of that what you will.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on. It’s still early. Let’s do something.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I have been toying around with an idea for 4D chess.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How about we just talk?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. In 4D chess…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. Come on, let’s talk about our lives. Tell me something about you I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I own nine pairs of pants.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, that, that’s a good start, but I was thinking maybe something a little more personal.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I see. I own nine pairs of underpants.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How about I go first?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But I don’t want to know how many underpants you own. Although, based on the floor of your bedroom, I’d say it’s a thousand.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, look, here’s something people do not know about me. When I first moved out to L.A., I did a topless scene in a low-budget horror movie about a killer gorilla. Ugh! After I did it, I felt so ashamed. Thankfully, that thing never came out.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ve seen that. Yeah. Serial Apeist. Howard found it online the day we met you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, God.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And it was literally the moment you walked out the door. But I see the type of personal revelations you’re going for. Okay, here’s one I thought I’d take to the grave.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hmm. A while back, YouTube changed its user interface from a star-based rating system to a thumbs-up rating system. I tell people I’m okay with it, but I’m really not.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s your big revelation?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. Whew, I feel ten pounds lighter.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, you know what? I give up. I’m going to bed.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Here’s something else you don’t know about me. You just hurt my feelings.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What did I do?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I opened up and shared something deeply upsetting to me, and you treated it as if it were nothing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I, I didn’t think it was a big deal.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It is to me; that’s the point.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, you are right. I’m really sorry. I should’ve known better.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Your apology is accepted.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you. How about a hug?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How about a hearty handshake?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now I know how you felt getting mauled by that sex-crazed gorilla.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Good night.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. It was rather flattering to have strangers send us drinks.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, that felt nice.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Maybe tomorrow morning we put on some hot pants and see if we can score us some free omelettes.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So, hypothetically, if, if we were to have gone with them, which one would you have picked?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I think I would have gone with the short one with the goofy haircut.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, good, ’cause I liked the tall thin one. He seemed intelligent, kind of a loner, maybe a little sexually inexperienced, like I’d have to teach him a thing or two.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Not my guy. I caught him staring at my rack. It’d be nice to be with a man who wants to know what’s underneath my cardigan. FYI, it’s another cardigan.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Your short sexed-up guy kind of sounds like Howard.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Your brainy virgin kind of sounds like Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Both
utterance.content: Good night.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Davis
utterance.content: All right, Dr. Koothrappali, it’s been nice talking to you, but I need to go home and relieve my babysitter.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, I can relate to being a single parent. I have a dog.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Davis
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s exactly the same thing. Good night.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Mrs. Davis, I, uh, I must confess, I came here tonight in a futile attempt to pick up some lonely postdoc, but instead I got to connect with you at a human level. That’s a much better evening. You’re a lovely person.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Davis
utterance.content: Are you hitting on me?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, no, no, that would be crazy. I mean, if I were hitting on you, you’d know it ’cause you’d feel uncomfortable and a little sad for me.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Davis
utterance.content: You’re sweet. Good night, Dr. Koothrappali.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Good night.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Looks like she accepted your apology.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And then some. I think we had a moment.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, please, you did not have a moment.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Who died and made you king of moments?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Let’s say there was a moment.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: There was.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: There wasn’t. But, but even if there was, what are you gonna do about it?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I will slowly seduce her until she falls helpless into my bed, hungry for the pleasure only I can give her.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So nothing.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, not a thing.

utterance.speaker: Penny (acting)
utterance.content: Ah, I’m so glad the police finally caught that psychotic genetically engineered ape.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (on ship)
utterance.content: That is my girlfriend. I swear to God.

utterance.speaker: Everyone (on ship)
utterance.content: Leonard! Leonard! Leonard! Leonard!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Aaaaaaah!
